content: Florian Kerschbaum Florian Kerschbaum Contact University of Waterloo David R. Cheriton School of Computer Science 200 University Ave W Waterloo, ON N2L 3G1 Canada Office: DC 3524 Email: florian.kerschbaum@uwaterloo.ca Note that I use strict spam filtering (due to a huge amount of spam) and if you think your email did not reach me, please use alternative means to contact me. About me I am a professor in the David R. Cheriton School of Computer Science at the University of Waterloo (joined in 2017), a member of the CrySP group, and NSERC/RBC chair in data security (since 2019). Before I worked as chief research expert at SAP in Karlsruhe (2005 – 2016) and as a software architect at Arxan Technologies in San Francisco (2002 – 2004). I hold a Ph.D. in computer science from the Karlsruhe Institute of Technology (2010) and a master's degree from Purdue University (2000). I served as the inaugural director of the Waterloo Cybersecurity and Privacy Institute (2018 – 2021). I am an ACM Distinguished Scientist (2019), a winner of the Outstanding Young Computer Science Researcher Award from CS-Can/Info-Can (2019) and a winner of the Faculty of Math Golden Jubilee Research Excellence Award (2022). I am interested in security and privacy in the entire data science lifecycle. I extend real-world systems with cryptographic security mechanisms to achieve (some) provable security guarantees. My work is used in several business applications. Software Projects AON-PRISMA: All-Or-Nothing Private Similarity Matching Awards Faculty of Math Golden Jubilee Research Excellence Award (2022) NSERC/RBC Chair in Data Security (2019) CS-Can/Info-Can Outstanding Young Computer Scientists (2019) ACM Distinguished Scientist (2019) NSERC Discovery Accelerator Supplement (2017) Students Note to applicants: I am looking for highly qualified graduate students excited to work on security and privacy in data science. Please apply directly to the CS program and list me as an intended supervisor. Do not send me email to review your application. I cannot guarantee admission. The only way to find out is to apply. All admitted applicants will be fully funded. If you still have questions, please see this information. If you want to nevertheless contact only me directly, please use "UWaterloo Graduate Application 2025" in the subject line. An answer is not guaranteed.
